text:
Hello, I am having an issue when I attempt to upload a directory that I previously fetched to my local machine via CLI. When I try to use the `hs upload XXXX XXXX` command, I keep getting this error:
`A TypeError has occurred. Cannot read property 'readdir' of undefined`
The directory exists on both local and remote
There’s no space in the directory names, is there? If so, you might need to wrap them in quotes.

Thanks Mark, there are no spaces in the directory names. I tried with and without quotes. I updated my node to v 14.4.0 and tried again (without restarting the terminal session) and get this:
```Starting up http-server, serving watch
Available on:
 <http://127.0.0.1:8080>
 <http://192.168.0.100:8080>
Hit CTRL-C to stop the server```
I’m not sure it’d doing anything though
yeah that definitely doesn’t look right… you do have the right package installed right? I think there might be another NPM package that has a similar name.
if you mean `@HubSpot/cli`  that is what I installed, then ran `hs init` , got my key, and was able to successfully `hs fetch` from my acct.
but hs watch and hs upload haven’t worked
I am running an old npm, so I can try updating it.
hm… I wouldn’t think that would do it, but wouldn’t hurt to update. Windows or Mac/Linux?
I’m updating my node to the latest too (14 -> 17)
No luck. It is giving me the above `Starting up…` no matter what command I do now
<@U26BLKGE4> Got it working! I needed to global default node version to the latest using nvm (node version manager). I really appreciate your help!
